🇯🇵🇯🇵🇯🇵 Reminder 🇯🇵🇯🇵🇯🇵

- Please fill in the Interest Survey for the Sept/Nov in-person plenary meeting in Tokyo.

- It only take 60s to complete. The deadline is Sunday 25th June (two days time).

- Thank you to the 30 people who have already completed it 👍

content.body: I'm preparing slides for https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo/ecma262/pull/4, and I'm wondering if it would be better to go through the proposal process or as a needs-consensus normative PR

* I'm preparing slides for https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo/ecma262/pull/4, and I'm wondering if it would be better to go through the proposal process or as a needs-consensus normative PR. Does anyone have opinions?

m.new_content.body: I'm preparing slides for https://github.com/nicolo-ribaudo/ecma262/pull/4, and I'm wondering if it would be better to go through the proposal process or as a needs-consensus normative PR. Does anyone have opinions?

content.body: i think we'd need a plenary discussion at least before deciding on that; i think "needs consensus" would only be if the semantics and motivation are so compelling and uncontroversial that we're all confident there's nothing else normative to discuss

* i think we'd need a plenary discussion at least before deciding on that; i think "needs consensus" would only be if the semantics and motivation are so compelling and uncontroversial that we're all confident there's basically nothing else normative to discuss

m.new_content.body: i think we'd need a plenary discussion at least before deciding on that; i think "needs consensus" would only be if the semantics and motivation are so compelling and uncontroversial that we're all confident there's basically nothing else normative to discuss

content.body: Ok I can end the slides asking "stage 1/2 or normative PR?"
* Ok, I can end the slides asking "stage 1/2 or normative PR?"
